com.wit.android.widget.adapter.internal

Class BaseWidgetAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • com.wit.android.widget.adapter.internal.BaseWidgetAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseAdapter

    public abstract class BaseWidgetAdapter
extends android.widget.BaseAdapter

    Class Overview

    Updated BaseAdapter implementation with accessible Resources and also LayoutInflater for better management when inflating, creating, and binding the views for an items provided by implementation of this adapter.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.widget.Adapter

        IGNORE_ITEM_VIEW_TYPE, NO_SELECTION

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseWidgetAdapter

        public BaseWidgetAdapter()

        Creates new instance of BaseWidgetAdapter without context. Note, that this adapter will not provide Resources or LayoutInflater which can be obtained form a context.

        See Also:
        BaseWidgetAdapter(android.content.Context)

      • BaseWidgetAdapter

        public BaseWidgetAdapter(android.content.Context context)

        Creates new instance of BaseWidgetAdapter with the given context. Resources, LayoutInflater and also the given context can be accessed immediately after an instance of this adapter is created.

        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be this adapter used.

    • Method Detail

      • dispatchSaveInstanceState

        public void dispatchSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)

        Called to save state of this adapter instance. If the given outState is invalid, there will be created a new bundle and onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle) will be invoked immediately.

        Parameters:
        outState - Outgoing state in which should this adapter instance save its state.
        See Also:
        onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle)

      • dispatchRestoreInstanceState

        public void dispatchRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle savedState)

        Called to restore state of this adapter instance. If the given savedState is valid, onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle) will be invoked immediately.

        Parameters:
        savedState - Should be the bundle with saved state in onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle).
        See Also:
        onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle)

      • getContext

        public android.content.Context getContext()

        Returns the context with which was this adapter created.

        Returns:
        Same context as in initialization.

      • getLayoutInflater

        public android.view.LayoutInflater getLayoutInflater()

        Returns layout inflater instance provided by the context passed during initialization of this adapter.

        Note, that LayoutInflater is provided only in case, when this adapter was created with a valid context.

        Returns:
        Layout inflater instance.

      • getResources

        public android.content.res.Resources getResources()

        Returns an application's resources provided by the context passed during initialization of this adapter.

        Note, that Resources are provided only in case, when this adapter was created with a valid context.

        Returns:
        An application's resources.

      • getItemId

        public long getItemId(int position)

      • inflate

        protected final android.view.View inflate(int resource)

        Inflates a new view hierarchy from the given xml resource.

        Parameters:
        resource - Resource id of a view to inflate.
        Returns:
        The root view of the inflated view hierarchy.
        See Also:
        LayoutInflater.inflate(int, android.view.ViewGroup)

      • onSaveInstanceState

        protected void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)

        Invoked to save state of this adapter instance. This is invoked whenever dispatchSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle) is called.

        Parameters:
        outState - Outgoing state. Always valid bundle.
        See Also:
        onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle)

      • onRestoreInstanceState

        protected void onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle savedState)

        Invoked to restore state of this adapter instance. Note, that this is invoked only in case that the bundle passed to dispatchRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle) is valid.

        Parameters:
        savedState - Bundle with saved data populated in onSaveInstanceState(Bundle). Always valid bundle.
